FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

  For further information contact : Todd Mahan, Saftey & Regulations manager
  
  l. The facility policy
     A. The owners,Managment,and Employees of Nichols Agriservice LLC., Nichols Iowa are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of Anhydrous Ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, The facility is prepared to work with the local Fire Department,LEPC, or other authorities, to migrate any release and to minimze the impact of the release on people and the enviroment.

  ll. Facility Information
     A. The primary activity at the facility is the storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia for sale to farmers.

     B. Anhydrous Ammonia is received, and distributed for application on crops as fertilizer nutrients.

     C. The maximum quanity stored would be 132,600 pounds in a 30,000 gallon storage tank *Note maximum quanity allowed to be stored is 85% of storage tank size.

 lll. The worst case release scenario and the alternative release scenario
      A. The worst case release scenario would be the release of the total contents of the storage tank over a ten minute time span. The maximum quanity released would be 132,600 pounds, which represents the volume of the tank at 85% capacity as limited by design standards. The distance to the toxic endpoint is 1.06 miles.

      B. The alternitive release scenario is based on a release from a break in a transfer hose. The distance to the toxic endpoint is 0.59 miles.

 lv. The accidental release, prevention program.

      A. The facility has implemented the provisions of the saftey requirements for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia, K-61, published by the American National Standards Institute Inc.

      B. The facility has implemented the standards of the U.S. Occupational Saftey and Health Administration , 29CFR 1910.111, storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia.

 V. The five year accident history.

      A. There has been no accidental release of anhydrous amm

onia that has caused any death, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility, nor have resulted in any off site deaths, injury, evacuations, sheltering, property damage, or inviromental damage.

 VI. The emergency response program.

      A. The facility has a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.

      B. The facility has provided to the state and local authorites, the emergency planning and community right to know information as required under SARA title III (EPCRA).

      C. The facility has a written emergency response program, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.120 including pre emergency planning and employee training.

  VII. Planned changes to improve safety.

      A. Saftey improvement is an ongoing process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are preformed to access the maintenance of safe conditions and evaluate employee training. There are no specific anhydrous ammonia saftey recommendations at this point in time.
